TopicTitle: "Micro" (2 stock krans and for their application)

Articles.Content:
These crafts are created on the eve of update 0.24. But how are they constructed?

Look - appreciate.

A very large crane! On its long boom, it can lift 21 tons.

With its shorter boom, it can lift 36 tons.

The crane weighs 140.84 tons. (213 parts)

The smaller crane, it can lift 0.6 tons

The smaller crane used on the Mun weighs 2.13 tons. (104 items)

The Mun station consists of 25 components (excluding cranes, connectors and the seat at the end of the base):

Central command module with the link.

2 switchboards.

3 connecters with solar panels.

A nuclear generator.

3 residential unit low comfort.

3 residential unit high comfort.

A water tank.

6 agricultural modules.

Food warehouse.

Laboratory module.

Research Module.

Drilling rig.

Storage and processing module.

Also featured:

Rover Scout. To select the landing site, and later as a spotlight.

Rover Chain. To assemble the Mun base further sent to the Dune.

Rover Marauder. For grabbing spent delivery stages. Later used as a tanker and an extra crane.

Rover Dumpster. It was sent to a landfill to dispose of things.

Crafts can be downloaded here:

http://kerbalspace.

ru/sandbox/sohraneniya-ksp/3436-micro.html

Edited December 8, 2014 by Shurnir

This is like, beyond cute. Lots of work there! And so tiny! Giggleplex would be proud.

Rune. Good job!

1. Thats pretty damn badass! Rep!

2. I'm kinda surprised that none of the debris hit the KSC or the crane!
That was the most beautiful stock gameplay!
